name: SecretsManagerGetSecret
description: Stores the value of a secret in AWS Secrets Manager into a secret build variable.
author: Amazon Web Services
helpMarkDown: Please refer to [Secrets Manager](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/secretsmanager/latest/userguide/) for more information.

inputs.name: awsCredentials
inputs.label: AWS Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specifies he credentials (a service endpoint type of 'AWS') for the task to use when it executes on a build host. New credentials can be created using the Services tab for your project.

If not supplied calls to AWS services made from the task will attempt to obtain credentials to be used in the following order:

* using Team Services variables associated with the build or release
* standard AWS environment variables in the build host's environment
* (if the build host is an EC2 instance) from an instance profile associated with the EC2 instance in its instance metadata.

inputs.name: regionName
inputs.label: AWS Region
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The AWS region code (us-east-1, us-west-2 etc) of the region containing the AWS resource(s) the task will use or create. For more information see [AWS Regions and Endpoints](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html). If not specified the task will attempt to obtain the region using the following order:

* from a Team Services variable associated with the build or release
* from the standard AWS_REGION environment variable in the build host environment
* (if the build host is an EC2 instance) from instance metadata associated with the EC2 instance.

inputs.name: secretIdOrName
inputs.label: Secret ID/Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the secret containing the version that you want to retrieve. You can specify either the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or the friendly name of the secret.

inputs.name: variableName
inputs.label: Variable Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the build variable to hold the value of the secret. *Note*: The variable will automatically be set to 'secret' mode.

inputs.name: versionId
inputs.label: Version ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the unique identifier of the version of the secret that you want to retrieve. If you specify this parameter then don't specify VersionStage. If you don't specify either a VersionStage or SecretVersionId then the default is to perform the operation on the version with the VersionStage value of AWSCURRENT.

inputs.name: versionStage
inputs.label: Version Stage
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Specifies the secret version that you want to retrieve by the staging label attached to the version.

Staging labels are used to keep track of different versions during the rotation process. If you use this parameter then don't specify SecretVersionId. If you don't specify either a VersionStage or SecretVersionId, then the default is to perform the operation on the version with the version stage value of AWSCURRENT.

inputs.name: logRequest
inputs.label: Log Request
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, request headers and other data for calls to AWS services are logged to the task's debug log.

inputs.name: logResponse
inputs.label: Log Response
inputs.helpMarkDown: If selected, the response metadata and body content of non-streaming responses from calls to AWS services are output to the task's debug log. The unique request ID, which can be useful when contacting AWS for support, is always logged to the task output regardless of this option setting.

messages.TaskCompleted: Successfully read the secret into the build variable '%s'.
